articles.headline: Unemployed, and Likely to Stay That Way
articles.snippet: The longer people stay out of work, the more trouble they have finding new work, adding to the challenge for policy makers trying to reduce joblessness.
articles.abstract: The longer people stay out of work, the more trouble they have finding new work, adding to the challenge for policy makers trying to reduce joblessness.
articles.lead_paragraph: The longer people stay out of work, the more trouble they have finding new work.

articles.headline: Cables Depict Afghan Graft, Starting at Top
articles.snippet: American officials trying to build support for the Afghan government are dispirited by its corruption.
articles.abstract: American officials trying to build support for the Afghan government are dispirited by its corruption.
articles.lead_paragraph: This article is by Scott Shane, Mark Mazzetti and Dexter Filkins.
articles.byline: By Scott Shane, Mark Mazzetti and Dexter Filkins

articles.headline: Obama Seeking Aid for Jobless in Deal on Tax Cuts
articles.snippet: The deal calls for jobless aid and tax breaks, but it is unclear how much leverage the White House has.
articles.abstract: The deal calls for jobless aid and tax breaks, but it is unclear how much leverage the White House has.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  The Obama administration is holding out for an extension of unemployment assistance and of a variety of expiring tax breaks for low-wage and middle-income workers as part of a deal with Congressional Republicans to extend all the Bush-era tax cuts.
articles.byline: By David M. Herszenhorn and Jackie Calmes

articles.headline: Digital Devices Can Become Objects of Affection
articles.snippet: Engineers and designers are beginning to think about our attachments and, yes, love of electronics like smartphones and tablets.
articles.abstract: Engineers and designers are beginning to think about our attachments and, yes, love of electronics like smartphones and tablets.
articles.lead_paragraph: I GAVE up my Palm Treo smartphone last year for an iPhone. It had been my companion for nearly five years, a long time for a cellphone. At the end people laughed at it, and by extension, at me. But I liked the feel of the thing. I liked what it, one of the first smartphones, could do.

articles.headline: Nonprofits Fear Losing Tax Benefit
articles.snippet: Charities worry that their fund-raising tax advantage could be eliminated in a deficit reduction move.
articles.abstract: Charities worry that their fund-raising tax advantage could be eliminated in a deficit reduction move.
articles.lead_paragraph: With the federal government struggling to regain control over the nation’s deficit, a debate is emerging over the charitable deduction and other tax policies that support nonprofit groups.

articles.headline: Euro Zone Is Imperiled by North-South Divide
articles.snippet: The union is divided between competitive export countries and uncompetitive deficit countries.
articles.abstract: The union is divided between competitive export countries and uncompetitive deficit countries.
articles.lead_paragraph: LISBON  Sara Vale Lima, sales manager at Eical, a Portuguese textile company, feels suffocated by the euro. The common currency once meant flush banks and easy credit, but these days it has laid bare a cold reality: Portugal shares the high wages and prices of richer northern European neighbors, but not their competitiveness.

articles.headline: A Novel Way to Sidestep Investor Suits
articles.snippet: If the Supreme Court rules in favor of Janus, other types of companies will create business structures that insulate them from lawsuits, legal experts say.
articles.abstract: If the Supreme Court rules in favor of Janus, other types of companies will create business structures that insulate them from lawsuits, legal experts say.
articles.lead_paragraph: One of the great legal fictions of Wall Street is that mutual funds are independent of the companies that create and run them.

articles.headline: Arizona Cuts Financing for Transplant Patients
articles.snippet: Budget cuts ended payments for certain transplants, a decision that amounts to a death sentence for some patients.
articles.abstract: Budget cuts ended payments for certain transplants, a decision that amounts to a death sentence for some patients.
articles.lead_paragraph: PHOENIX  Even physicians with decades of experience telling patients that their lives are nearing an end are having difficulty discussing a potentially fatal condition that has arisen in Arizona: Death by budget cut.

articles.headline: Cross Section of Rich Invested With the Fed
articles.snippet: Hundreds of wealthy but lesser-known investors participated in the Federal Reserve’s emergency lending program.
articles.abstract: Hundreds of wealthy but lesser-known investors participated in the Federal Reserve’s emergency lending program.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  One investor, Kenneth H. Dahlberg, is a World War II flying ace who, as a volunteer in President Richard M. Nixon’s re-election campaign, was a minor figure in the Watergate scandal.
articles.byline: By Sewell Chan and Ben Protess

articles.headline: Few New Jobs as Jobless Rate Rises to 9.8%
articles.snippet: The economy added only 39,000 jobs in November, dampening hopes that a recovery was building.
articles.abstract: The economy added only 39,000 jobs in November, dampening hopes that a recovery was building.
articles.lead_paragraph: After several months of improvement, hiring by businesses slowed to a crawl in November, a development that is sure to intensify the debate over what can and should be done to reignite the economy.
